newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Rain raises Belgian sugarbeet root weight.
newsitem.headline: Rain raises Belgian sugarbeet root weight.

text.p: Heavy recent rain caused a sharp drop in sugar content but raised beet root weight, an official of Belgium's Royal Institute for Improvement of Sugarbeet said.
The institute's second beet test on Thursday showed sugar content of 14.04 percent, compared with 15.94 percent in the first test on August 8 and 15.93 percent in the second test a year-ago.
Average root weight was 46.18 tonnes per hectare, against 30.97 tonnes in the first test and 40.29 tonnes a year ago.
"Further rain will improve yields," the official said, adding that the harvest was expected to start early October.
Average sugar yield in the second test was marginally higher at 6.48 tonnes per hectare, against 6.42 tonnes a year-ago but below the 10-year average of 6.72 tonnes.
The third and final Belgian beet test will be held on September 2 with results released on September 5.
